{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524175,"name":"Layton","username":"LaytonK737","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/aca169/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T23:46:24.597Z","cooked":"
andymark.com

Powerpole Distribution Board Control Bundle

Components in this Bundle:1 - Power Pole Distribution Board (am-3699a)1 - Powerpole Kit (am-2198)1 - 12 Gauge Wire (am-4698-25)

We are wondering if we can use these there sold by Andy mark so I wouldn‚Äôt see why not but it‚Äôs not in the rule book

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T23:46:24.597Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":373,"readers_count":372,"score":109.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491270,"topic_slug":"are-these-legal","display_username":"Layton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/powerpole-distribution-board-control-bundle","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Powerpole Distribution Board Control Bundle - AndyMark, Inc","clicks":76}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/are-these-legal/491270/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3524192,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T00:02:46.048Z","cooked":"

It used to be sold by andymark. Notice they have none in stock.

I believe they are legal if you only use it with one device plugged in, and with the fuse removed and replaced with a solid wire.

If you use it to split power to a second device, then you run into violations because you‚Äôve forked a single PDH output into two devices. If it has a fuse, that also causes problems. Both are covered here:

frctools.com

Rule R621

R621      *Protect circuits with appropriate circuit breakers. Each branch circuit must be protected by 1 and only 1 circuit breaker or fuse on the PDP/PDH per Table 8‚Äë3. No other electrical load can be connected to the...

tekdemo:

I believe they are legal if you only use it with one device plugged in, and with the fuse removed and replaced with a solid wire.

i think this is only true if the device is an actuator or core control system item, based on the fact that CUSTOM CIRCUITS can have any amount on one breaker, and the blue box exception for R621.

CUSTOM CIRCUIT Any active electrical item that is not an actuator (specified in R501) or
core control system item (specified in R710)

if this interpretation is not true, please point it out as weve got like 6 sensors wired in parallel like this

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T00:10:56.079Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":123.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491270,"topic_slug":"are-these-legal","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/are-these-legal/491270/3","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524204,"name":"Duncan Macdonald","username":"Duncan_Macdonald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/duncan_macdonald/{size}/2042_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T00:13:31.814Z","cooked":"

You‚Äôre fine. A good rule of thumb is don‚Äôt listen to someone who links to last year‚Äôs rules.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T00:13:31.814Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":229,"readers_count":228,"score":110.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491270,"topic_slug":"are-these-legal","display_username":"Duncan Macdonald","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57670,"username":"nevadexehs","name":"neev dadhania","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6295,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá®üá¶"},"post_url":"/t/are-these-legal/491270/4","custom_user_title":"üá®üá¶","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3524310,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T01:43:33.928Z","cooked":"

That‚Äôs a very good rule of thumb, yes. I didn‚Äôt catch that, since usually power management is evergreen, and I wouldn‚Äôt assume small connectors when looking at a high power fused breakout.

Grabbing the proper citations for that (and current year), yeah. You‚Äôre good.

frctools.com

Rule R623

R623       *Use only appropriate connectors. Branch circuits may include intermediate elements such as COTS connectors, splices, COTS flexible/rolling/sliding contacts, and COTS slip rings, as long as the entire...

frctools.com

Rule R621

R621       *Protect circuits with appropriate circuit breakers. Each branch circuit must be protected by 1 and only 1 circuit breaker or fuse on the PDP/PDP2.0/PDH per Table 8‚Äë3. No other electrical load can be...

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T01:43:33.928Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491270,"topic_slug":"are-these-legal","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R623","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R623 | FRCTools","clicks":3},{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R621","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R621 | FRCTools","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6295,"username":"Duncan_Macdonald","name":"Duncan Macdonald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/duncan_macdonald/{size}/2042_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/are-these-legal/491270/5","custom_user_title":"2811 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3528333,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T23:21:46.518Z","cooked":"

You cannot wire this directly to the battery. This is mostly due to the part of R609 between bullets D and E:

No additional devices or modifications shall be permitted with the following exceptions:

And this is not listed anywhere in R609. Also R610.

You may, however use this behind one of the fuses/breakers of the PDP [12]/PDH to allow smaller wiring within a CUSTOM CIRCUIT with sub-branches (twigs?), as allowed by the blue box of R621:

This rule does not prohibit the use of ‚Ä¶ any fuses or breakers within CUSTOM CIRCUITS for additional protection.

As I read it (and I‚Äôve never heard otherwise), use of the word protection in this blue box authorizes use of smaller wires by repeated use of the word ‚Äúprotected‚Äù in the ‚Äúapplication‚Äù column of R622.

Bottom line (admittedly simplified such that I didn‚Äôt cover every case):

  • wired without passing through a PDP/PDH: illegal
  • powering more than one actuator, or an actuator and anything else: illegal
  • within a CUSTOM CIRCUIT: legal
